intro: Oenanthe corticata, commonly known as the bark lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Oenanthe corticata is noted for its aromatic foliage and its historical use in traditional medicine.
